paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: presented with heart failure and neurological features
individual_records.evidence_sentence: He was found to be heterozygous for a pathogenic variant in the TTR gene c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) associated with hereditary ATTR-CM.

individual_records.phenotype_details: pre-symptomatic, planned for serial screening ECGs and TTEs
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The same pathogenic variant in the TTR gene c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) was detected in both his children.

individual_records.phenotype_details: pre-symptomatic, planned for serial screening ECGs and TTEs
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The same pathogenic variant in the TTR gene c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) was detected in both his children.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with hereditary ATTR-CM, leading to amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the proband and his affected family members.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical presentation and genetic testing
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of the disease varies among variants, with some individuals developing symptoms early in adulthood, while some remain asymptomatic throughout their lives.
key_quotes: The same pathogenic variant in the TTR gene c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) was detected in both his children.
Penetrance of the disease varies among variants, with some individuals developing symptoms early in adulthood, while some remain asymptomatic throughout their lives.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
